Можешь себе представить? [пауза] А её родной отец мне говорил, что я зря время трачу. [с горечью] Что я ей ложные надежды даю. Но я знал—в смысле, я всегда знал, что у неё всё получится. original_conversation.content: She got in. [extremely happy] She actually got in! [laugh] I just—I can't even process this right now. [crying while speaking] When she called me, I literally dropped my phone. Three years ago, her guidance counselor said, um... said she should consider "alternative paths." [angry] Alternative paths! Can you believe that? [pause] And her own dad told me I was wasting my time. [bitter] Said I was giving her false hope. But I knew—I mean, I always knew she had it in her. [warm] The way she'd stay after our sessions, asking questions about everything. How she'd, erm, rewrite her essays twelve times until they were perfect. [emotional] God, there were nights she'd text me at 2 AM, completely falling apart. [shaky voice] "I can't do this, I'm not smart enough, everyone's right about me." [sniffle] And now look. [proudly] Full scholarship to State. Full scholarship! [laugh loudly] I keep wanting to call everyone who doubted her and just—I don't know, gloat? [chuckle] Is that terrible? [pause] Actually, no. You know what? [confidently] They should know. They should all know what happens when you actually believe in someone. [very sincerely] When you refuse to give up on them. [crying while speaking] She's going to change the world, I just know it.
